conclusion: To determine the number of moments when the speed of the particle is 5 m/s, we need to analyze the displacement-time graph and understand how speed is related to the slope of the tangent line at any point on the graph.
The graph shows displacement x as a function of time t. The displacement starts at x = 10 m at t = 0 and decreases to x = -10 m at t = 4 s.

Speed is the magnitude of velocity, which is the derivative of displacement with respect to time, v = dx/dt. The speed at any moment is given by the slope of the tangent line to the curve at that point.
We need to find points on the graph where the slope of the tangent line is 5 m/s.
The tangent lines are drawn in the images provided. The first image shows a tangent line at the beginning of the graph, where the slope is steep, indicating a high speed.
The second image shows a tangent line around t = 2 s, where the slope is moderate.
The third image shows a tangent line near t = 4 s, where the slope is less steep compared to the first image.
To calculate the slope of the tangent lines, we can use the change in displacement over the change in time.
For the second image, the slope is approximately Δx/Δt = (10 - 0) / (0 - 2) = -5 m/s.
For the third image, the slope is approximately Δx/Δt = (0 - (-10)) / (2 - 4) = -5 m/s.
There are two moments when the speed is 5 m/s, corresponding to the times when the slope of the tangent line is -5 m/s.
There are two moments when the speed of the particle is 5 m/s.
